oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cereal Populations - Coping With Unpredictable Weather And Climate
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fradgley, Nick
Wolfe, Martin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Production systems
Crop combinations and interactions
Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Breeding, genetics and propagation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Diverse composite cross populations (CCPs) consisting of thousands of segregating lines are created by crossing a number of parent varietes. Populations demonstrate greater resilience in unfavorable conditions at sowing in Autumn 2012 due to poor weather and high levels of Fusarium infection in seed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Fradgley, Nick and Wolfe, Martin (2013) Cereal Populations - Coping With Unpredictable Weather And Climate. Poster at: Wakelyn's Open Day 2013, Wakelyns Agroforrestry Metfield , 26 June. [Completed]
